The French, on this 6th of May, have just chosen the change by taking me to the presidency of the Republic.
I measure the honor that is done to me and the task that awaits me.
Before you, I pledge to serve my country.
I address a Republican salute to Nicolas Sarkozy, who presided over France for 5 years and deserves our respect.
I am proud to have been able to raise hope!
The change that I propose to you must be at the height of France. It starts now!
I will be the President of all the French!
Tonight, there are no two France facing each other, there is only one nation united in the same destiny.
Everyone in the Republic will be treated with equal rights and duties.
I ask to be judged on two major commitments: justice and youth!
I mentioned the last few months the French Dream: it is our History, it is our future. It's simply called progress!
It is this French Dream that I will strive to accomplish for the mandate I have been given.
May 6 must be a great date for our country, a new start for Europe, a new hope for the world!
My mission, my duty, is to serve the Republic, to serve France!
